required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy Assessment of an Automatic Blood Pressure Measurement Device in Adult Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy Assessment of an Automatic Blood Pressure Measurement Device in Adult Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock:
The research team has developed an automatic blood pressure monitor (Sphygmo) to be used for the monitoring and diagnosis of pre-eclampsia in pregnant women, particularly in low-resource settings where current monitoring is limited.
90 adult volunteers will be enrolled by researchers at Rice University. The participant will be seated in a comfortable chair with arm at heart level. Arm circumference will be measured and a blood pressure cuff will be placed on the arm. The cuff will be inflated and blood pressure measurements will be taken by a commercially available device and by the Sphygmo device. Blood pressure measurements from both devices will be recorded. The participant's blood pressure will be measured up to 9 times with a waiting period of 45-60 seconds between each measurement.
The results of this study will be used to optimize the blood pressure detection algorithm and thus further develop the device.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants enrolled in the study will have their blood pressure measured multiple times with both the GE Dinamap Procare commercial blood pressure monitor and Sphygmo, the experimental blood pressure monitoring device.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of Blood Pressure Measurement by Sphygmo Relative to the Clinical Standard.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood pressure was measured an average of 9 times for each participant during their single visit and the mean of these measurements was recorded and used for analysis. The measurement period lasted approximately 30-45 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: Mean difference of systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings between Sphygmo device and the gold standard sphygmomanometer.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Sphygmo Readings That Were With < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and < 15 mmHg of the Readings by the Gold Standard Sphygmomanometer.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood pressure was measured an average of 9 times for each participant during their single visit and the mean of these measurements was recorded and used for analysis. The measurement period lasted approximately 30-45 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: The British Hypertension society defines a specific criteria for the accuracy of a sphygmomanometer. Devices are graded according to the cumulative percentage of readings that have an absolute difference between the more favorable observer's mercury sphygmomanometer readings and the test device of < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and < 15 mmHg. A letter grade of "A" requires that over 60%, 85%, and 95% were achieved in the < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and <15 mmHg categories, respectively. A letter grade of "B" requires that over 50%, 75%, and 90% were achieved in the < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and <15 mmHg categories, respectively. The test device achieved a grade of (B/B) with the validation data from this study.

arm_group.description: Men and women over the age of 18 will have their blood pressure measured with both the Sphygmo: Automatic Blood Pressure Monitor device and the GE Dinamap ProCare automatic blood pressure monitor.

intervention.description: A team of engineers from Rice University has recently developed Sphygmo, an ambulatory, low-cost blood pressure monitor for use in the diagnosis and management of pre-eclampsia in low-resource hospitals.

intervention.intervention_name: GE Dinamap ProCare Automatic Blood Pressure Monitor
intervention.description: This commercially available gold standard blood pressure monitor will be used as a control to assess the accuracy of the Sphygmo device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to provide informed consent

responsible_party.investigator_title: Stanley C. Moore Professor of Bioengineering

group.title: Healthy Adult Volunteers
group.description: Men and women over the age of 18 who will have their blood pressure measured using both the experimental blood pressure monitor (Sphygmo), and the gold-standard, commercial blood pressure monitor (GE Dinamap ProCare).

group.title: Adults Volunteers
group.description: Men and women over the age of 18 Sphygmo: Automatic Blood Pressure Monitor: A team of engineers from Rice University has recently developed Sphygmo, an ambulatory, low-cost blood pressure monitor for use in the diagnosis and management of pre-eclampsia in low-resource hospitals.

outcome.title: Accuracy of Blood Pressure Measurement by Sphygmo Relative to the Clinical Standard.
outcome.description: Mean difference of systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings between Sphygmo device and the gold standard sphygmomanometer.
outcome.time_frame: Blood pressure was measured an average of 9 times for each participant during their single visit and the mean of these measurements was recorded and used for analysis. The measurement period lasted approximately 30-45 minutes.
outcome.population: Data from nine participants of the original 81 who completed the study was excluded on account of the observer reporting a difficulty in hearing, movement, or uncertainty with the measurement.

group.title: Healthy Adult Volunteers
group.description: Men and women over the age of 18 who had their blood pressure measured using both the experimental device (Sphygmo) as well as the commercial, gold-standard monitor (GE Dinamap ProCare).

measure.title: Accuracy of Blood Pressure Measurement by Sphygmo Relative to the Clinical Standard.
measure.description: Mean difference of systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings between Sphygmo device and the gold standard sphygmomanometer.
measure.population: Data from nine participants of the original 81 who completed the study was excluded on account of the observer reporting a difficulty in hearing, movement, or uncertainty with the measurement.

outcome.title: Percentage of Sphygmo Readings That Were With < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and < 15 mmHg of the Readings by the Gold Standard Sphygmomanometer.
outcome.description: The British Hypertension society defines a specific criteria for the accuracy of a sphygmomanometer. Devices are graded according to the cumulative percentage of readings that have an absolute difference between the more favorable observer's mercury sphygmomanometer readings and the test device of < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and < 15 mmHg. A letter grade of "A" requires that over 60%, 85%, and 95% were achieved in the < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and <15 mmHg categories, respectively. A letter grade of "B" requires that over 50%, 75%, and 90% were achieved in the < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and <15 mmHg categories, respectively. The test device achieved a grade of (B/B) with the validation data from this study.
outcome.time_frame: Blood pressure was measured an average of 9 times for each participant during their single visit and the mean of these measurements was recorded and used for analysis. The measurement period lasted approximately 30-45 minutes.
outcome.population: Data from nine participants of the original 81 who completed the study was excluded on account of the observer reporting a difficulty in hearing, movement, or uncertainty with the measurement.

group.description: Men and women over the age of 18 who will have their blood pressure measured using both the experimental blood pressure monitor (Sphygmo), and the gold-standard, commercial blood pressure monitor (GE Dinamap ProCare).

measure.description: The British Hypertension society defines a specific criteria for the accuracy of a sphygmomanometer. Devices are graded according to the cumulative percentage of readings that have an absolute difference between the more favorable observer's mercury sphygmomanometer readings and the test device of < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and < 15 mmHg. A letter grade of "A" requires that over 60%, 85%, and 95% were achieved in the < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and <15 mmHg categories, respectively. A letter grade of "B" requires that over 50%, 75%, and 90% were achieved in the < 5 mmHg, < 10 mmHg, and <15 mmHg categories, respectively. measure.units: percentage of measurements in that range

group.title: Adults Volunteers
group.description: Men and women over the age of 18 Sphygmo: Automatic Blood Pressure Monitor: A team of engineers from Rice University has recently developed Sphygmo, an ambulatory, low-cost blood pressure monitor for use in the diagnosis and management of pre-eclampsia in low-resource hospitals.

event.description: One healthy volunteer presented with abnormally high blood pressure. EMS was called and the subject was evaluated. Following the evaluation, the subject was advised to visit their primary care physician regarding their high blood pressure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
